text: A group of people who live together under a common law within a definite territory is a
explanation:
A state is a community of persons, more or less numerous, occupying a definite territory, possessing an organized government, and enjoying independence from external control.

text: Political socialization is associated with

options.A: Military take over of civilian government

explanation:
How a person determines his or her political beliefs is called political socialization. It  is a lifelong process by which people form their ideas about politics and acquire political values. It is associated with the transmission of political values
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: According to Aristotle, a form of government in which the few rule for the benefit of all is
explanation:
Aristocracy is a kind of government that puts power in the hands of a small, privileged ruling class.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Rule by the old people is known as
explanation:
Gerontocracy; a state, society, or group governed by old people. Government based on rule by old people.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Rules adjudication is a primary function of the
explanation:
Adjudication is the legal process by which an arbiter or judge reviews evidence and argumentation, including legal reasoning set forth by opposing parties or litigants, to come to a decision which determines rights and obligations between the parties involved. Its the function of the judiciary
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The judiciary controls the executive in federal state through
explanation:
Judicial review; power of the courts of a country to examine the actions of the legislative, executive, and administrative arms of the government and to determine whether such actions are consistent with the constitution.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: One major advantage of the unitary system is that it tends to make government
explanation:
One major advantage of a unitary system is that the responsibilities and powers of government tend to be fairly clear-cut. In times of crisis, a clear division of power often results in more swift reactions and assistance than in a form of government where power is divided between multiple government entities.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The presidential system differs from the parliamentary system of government in that

options.A: The principle of collective responsibility applies
options.B: Executive and legislative powers are fused
options.C: Powers of the three arms of government are merged
options.D: The tenure of office of the president is limited

explanation:
The salient distinction between the two classes of systems is that, in a presidential system, executive power is constitutionally vested in a single individual (i.e., the president) for a limited number of years, whereas, in a parliamentary system, executive power is vested in the legislature (i.e., parliament, which chooses a prime minister)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following advocates equitable distribution of wealth?
explanation:
Socialism is a political and economic theory of social organization which advocates that the means of production, distribution, and exchange should be owned or regulated by the community as a whole.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A constitution that is difficult to amend is
explanation:
Rigid constitution refers to that one which could only be amended by a very difficult special procedure.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following constitutions is more suitable for centralization of political power?
explanation:
A centralized government  is one in which power or legal authority is exerted or coordinated by a political executive to which federal states, local authorities, and smaller units are considered subject. Power is concentrated at the top and other units are considered subjects. The best kind of constitution to be adopted here would be Flexible constitution that can be easily amended when need arises
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following types of citizenship cannot be withdrawn?
explanation:
For a natural-born citizen, losing your citizenship is actually quite difficult. The law prohibits the taking of your citizenship against your will, but there are certain actions a citizen can take which are assumed to be a free-will decision that constitutes a voluntary renunciation of the citizenship
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The right of citizens to vote is
explanation:
Universal suffrage is the right of almost all adults to vote in political elections.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A political party is different from a pressure group in its
explanation:
pressure groups differ from political parties in two main ways: • A pressure group usually has a narrow program dealing only with its own particular interests, while a political party usually deals with a wide range of issues. Their objectives are different
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: One of the functions of pressure groups is to

options.C: Articulate the opinion of their members
options.D: Contest elections to serve the people

explanation:
Pressure groups are a vital link between the government and the governed. They keep governments more responsive to the wishes of the community, especially in between elections.
. Pressure groups are able to express the views of minority groups in the community who might not otherwise receive a hearing.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Under the 1979 Constitution, statutory allocation of revenue to local government councils is the responsibility of the
explanation:
The1979 constitutionempowered the National Assembly to determine what proportion of the federation account and a state'srevenueshould beallocatedtolocal governments.

text: Under Nigeria's Second Republic, the Senate was under the leadership of
explanation:
When General Olusegun Obasanjo terminated military rule in 1979, Joseph Wayas was elected to the Senate on the National Party of Nigeria (NPN) platform and appointed Senate President.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The Revenue Mobilization, Allocation and Fiscal Commission is statutorily empowered to determine the remuneration of
explanation:
monitoring the accruals to and disbursement of revenue from the Federal Account and reviewing, from time to time, the revenue allocation formulae to ensure conformity with changing realities
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The primary function of the Code of Conduct Bureau is to

options.D: Ensure due process by public officers

explanation:
The Code of Conduct Bureau and Tribunal Act, Chapter 58 LFN 1990 was enacted giving CCB the decree to establish, maintain and sustain public morality in the conduct of government organizations and to make sure that the behavior of public officers also comply to the highest quality of public morality and accountability.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The party system practiced in Nigeria's Third Republic was
explanation:
They were a two part system . The center-right National Republican Convention (NRC) and the center-left Social Democratic Party (SDP). The parties were required to draw from a national rather than regional or tribal basis.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Nigeria adopted the federal system of government because of

options.C: The adoption of a state religion
options.D: The fear of domination of minorities

explanation:
The demand for the creation of newer states in Nigeria tends to emanate from sub-state groups, often ethnic- or tribal-interest groups, which accuse the current larger state governments of subverting or ignoring the interests and necessities of the more local regions.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The highest policy making body under the Gowon Regime was
explanation:
Supreme Military Council was established by Yakubu Gowon and ruled Nigeria from 1966-1979 until the Second Nigerian Republic.

text: Nigeria became a federation of thirty-six state during the era of
explanation:

explanation:

text: The main representative body of the United Nations is the
explanation:
The Charter established six principal organs of the United Nations: the General Assembly, the Security Council, the Economic and Social Council, the Trusteeship Council, the International Court of Justice, and the Secretariat.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The AU differs from the OAU in having

options.D: No assembly of Heads of State

explanation: TheAfrican Union (AU), established in 2002, differs from theOrganization of African Unity (OAU), which was dissolved in 2001, in several key areas. One of the significant differences is that the AU has moreeffective tools for decision enforcement. This includes institutions like theAfrican Court on Human and Peoples' Rightsandthe Peace and Security Council, which are designed to takeactionon decisions, enforce policies and address conflicts. Both organisations had an assembly of Heads of States but under different names. While the OAU had the Assembly of Heads of States and Governments, the AU had the Assembly of the African Union.
